articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Harold Isaac, Sarah Morland
articles.description: Gang members brandishing automatic rifles stormed through a town in Haiti's main breadbasket region, killing at least 70 and forcing over 6,000 to flee, causing widespread shock even in a country grown accustomed to outbreaks of violence.
articles.title: Haitian gang slaughters at least 70 people as thousands flee

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: The Biden administration will not renew a temporary humanitarian entry program for hundreds of thousands of migrants with U.S. sponsors who arrived in recent years, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said on Friday.
articles.title: U.S. will not renew legal status for hundreds of thousands of migrants

articles.author: Bruno Kelly, Jake Spring
articles.description: The river port in the Amazon rainforest's largest city of Manaus on Friday hit its lowest level since 1902, as a drought drains waterways and snarls transport of grain exports and essential supplies that are the region's lifeline.
articles.title: Brazil drought sinks Amazon rainforest port river level to 122-year low

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: The European Commission said on Friday it had received enough support from EU members to impose tariffs of up to 45% on Chinese electric vehicle imports in the bloc's highest profile trade case, but would continue to negotiate with Beijing.
articles.title: EU executive to adopt tariffs on Chinese EVs after vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of Tunisians marched in the capital on Friday, escalating protests against President Kais Saied, two days before what they say is an unfair presidential vote in which Saied has removed most other candidates to remain in power.
articles.title: Tunisians protest against President Saied two days before presidential vote

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: As the Gaza war nears its first anniversary, previously unreported email exchanges between senior Biden administration officials show that Washington was warned early on that Israel might be committing war crimes.
articles.title: Emails show early US concerns over Gaza offensive, risk of Israeli war crimes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday he had visited the northern Sumy region, from where Ukraine launched a major incursion into the neighbouring Russian Kursk region.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy visits Sumy region bordering Russia's Kursk province

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan former presidential candidate Edmundo Gonzalez said on Friday that he intended to travel back to his country on Jan. 10 to take office as "elected president".
articles.title: Ex-presidential candidate Gonzalez says he will return to Venezuela to take office in January

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean military transport aircraft is evacuating 97 citizens and family members from Lebanon amid escalating tension and will return to South Korea on Saturday afternoon, the country's foreign ministry said.
articles.title: South Korea military aircraft evacuates 97 from Lebanon amid escalating tension
